Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Description: A tragic story of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird (Updated)
Author: Harper Lee
Description: A timeless story of justice, morality, and compassion, following young Scout Finch as she navigates the deep-rooted prejudices of the American South.

Author: George Orwell
Description: A dystopian vision of totalitarian control and surveillance.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Author: Jane Austen
Description: A witty romance exploring class, pride, and misunderstandings.

Title: Moby-Dick
Author: Herman Melville
Description: The epic quest of Captain Ahab to hunt the white whale.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Author: J.D. Salinger
Description: A rebellious teenager’s journey through New York City.

Title: The Hobbit
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on a grand adventure with dwarves.

Title: Fahrenheit 451
Author: Ray Bradbury
Description: A society where books are banned and burned by firemen.

Title: Jane Eyre
Author: Charlotte Brontë
Description: A young woman’s struggle for love, independence, and identity.

Title: Brave New World
Author: Aldous Huxley
Description: A futuristic society driven by technology, control, and pleasure.
